### 1. OCA Maintainer Tools - Core Repository

- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (module structure, automation, quality)
- **Tags**: oca, maintainer-tools, pre-commit, automation, readme-generation

### 2. OCA Pre-commit Hooks Configuration

- **Link**: https://github.com/OCA/odoo-pre-commit-hooks
- **Date/Version**: 2024-10, Odoo 16.0-18.0
- **Source Type**: OCA Repository
- **Quality Score**: 90 (OCA repository + recent 2024 + OCA aligned)
- **Takeaway**: Linters complementing pylint-odoo with oca-checks-odoo-module and oca-checks-po hooks for code quality
- **Snippet**: `.pre-commit-config.yaml` includes `oca-checks-odoo-module` and `oca-checks-po --fix` hooks for automated validation
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (code quality, linting, ci-cd)
- **Tags**: oca, pre-commit, linting, code-quality, validation

### 3. OCA Addons Repository Template

- **Link**: https://github.com/OCA/oca-addons-repo-template
- **Date/Version**: 2024-11, Odoo 11.0-19.0
- **Source Type**: OCA Repository
- **Quality Score**: 90 (OCA repository + recent 2024 + OCA aligned + version 19.0 support)
- **Takeaway**: Copier-based template for standardized OCA repository setup with Poetry, pytest, and GitHub Actions CI/CD
- **Snippet**: `copier copy --UNSAFE https://github.com/OCA/oca-addons-repo-template.git some-repo` bootstraps new repository
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (project scaffolding, ci-cd, standardization)
- **Tags**: oca, copier, scaffolding, ci-cd, github-actions

### 4. OCA Multi-Company Security Patterns

- **Link**: https://github.com/OCA/multi-company
- **Date/Version**: 2024, Odoo 16.0-18.0
- **Source Type**: OCA Repository
- **Quality Score**: 90 (OCA repository + recent + multi-company patterns)
- **Takeaway**: Defines custom views and security rules for multi-company environments with proper record rule patterns
- **Snippet**: Use `'in'` operator in record rules instead of `'child_of'` for multi-company access control
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (security, multi-company, record-rules)
- **Tags**: oca, multi-company, security, record-rules, access-control

### 5. OCA Contribution Guidelines

- **Link**: https://github.com/OCA/maintainer-tools/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
- **Date/Version**: 2024-11
- **Source Type**: OCA Guidelines
- **Quality Score**: 90 (OCA guidelines + recent)
- **Takeaway**: Module manifest requirements include name, version (X.Y.Z.A.B format), license (LGPL-3), author, website, depends, data
- **Snippet**: Version format: `{Odoo major}.{Odoo minor}.{addon major}.{addon minor}.{addon patch}`
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (module structure, licensing, versioning)
- **Tags**: oca, manifest, versioning, licensing, contribution

### 6. OCA Module Template Structure

- **Link**: https://github.com/OCA/maintainer-tools/tree/master/template/module
- **Date/Version**: 2024-11
- **Source Type**: OCA Repository
- **Quality Score**: 90 (OCA repository + template + recent)
- **Takeaway**: Standard module structure with __manifest__.py, README.rst generation from fragments in readme/ folder
- **Snippet**: `oca-gen-addon-readme --repo-name=server-auth --branch=10.0 --addon-dir=auth_keycloak` generates README automatically
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (module structure, documentation)
- **Tags**: oca, template, module-structure, readme, documentation

### 7. OCA Migration to Odoo 17.0

- **Link**: https://github.com/OCA/maintainer-tools/wiki/Migration-to-version-17.0
- **Date/Version**: 2024-09, Odoo 17.0
- **Quality Score**: 95 (OCA guidelines + recent + version-specific + migration guidance)
- **Takeaway**: Odoo 17.0 replaces flake8, isort, pyupgrade with ruff; uses .ruff.toml instead of .flake8 and .isort.cfg
- **Snippet**: Run `pre-commit run -a` to apply linters/formatters, commit auto-fixes separately before migration
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (migration, code-quality, linting)
- **Tags**: oca, migration, odoo-17, ruff, linting

- **Date/Version**: Odoo 17.0
- **Source Type**: Official Documentation
- **Quality Score**: 100 (official docs + deployment best practices)
- **Takeaway**: Three branch stages: production (live code), staging (test with prod data), development (demo data for unit tests)
- **Snippet**: Production branch restarts on push; staging uses neutralized prod DB duplicates; development uses demo data
- **Application**: odoo-sh-devops (deployment, branches, workflow)
- **Tags**: official, odoo-sh, branches, deployment, workflow

## Community Wisdom References (6 citations)

### 15. Stack Overflow: Computed Field Performance Optimization

- **Link**: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/52309255/odoo-11-improving-performance-of-computed-search-method-when-no-direct-relatio
- **Date/Version**: 2023+ activity
- **Source Type**: Stack Overflow
- **Quality Score**: 70 (accepted answer + performance focus)
- **Takeaway**: Never compute availability for 1000+ products in single shots; use one big search/read or avoid computed fields entirely
- **Snippet**: Stock availability is slow in Odoo; use aggregated queries instead of per-record computation
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (performance, computed-fields)
- **Tags**: stackoverflow, performance, computed-field, optimization

### 16. Stack Overflow: Many2many Relationship Patterns

- **Link**: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57477013/many2many-field-related-to-another-model
- **Date/Version**: 2023+ activity
- **Source Type**: Stack Overflow
- **Quality Score**: 70 (accepted answer + relational patterns)
- **Takeaway**: Define different relation table names when using same models in multiple Many2many fields to prevent data collision
- **Snippet**: `relation='student_teacher_rel', column1='course_id', column2='student_id'` creates explicit junction table
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (orm, many2many, relationships)
- **Tags**: stackoverflow, many2many, orm, relationships

### 17. Stack Overflow: Record Rules Security Best Practices

- **Link**: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65776664/odoo-13-record-rules-write-access-on-specific-records
- **Date/Version**: 2023+ activity
- **Source Type**: Stack Overflow
- **Quality Score**: 70 (security patterns + multi-company)
- **Takeaway**: Access control via ACLs and record rules; group rules are additive, global rules are subtractive; use sudo() to bypass
- **Snippet**: Don't use `user.company_id.id` (default company); use Enabled Companies in context for multi-company
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (security, record-rules, multi-company)
- **Tags**: stackoverflow, security, record-rules, multi-company, acl

### 18. Stack Overflow: Computed Field store=True Behavior

- **Link**: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/31945069/odoo-computed-fields-works-without-store-true-doesnt-work-with-store-true
- **Date/Version**: 2023+ activity
- **Source Type**: Stack Overflow
- **Quality Score**: 70 (accepted answer + computed field patterns)
- **Takeaway**: store=True saves computed value to database; value recomputed when any @api.depends field updates
- **Snippet**: Use store=True for fields in list views or search domains; non-stored for rarely accessed calculations
- **Application**: odoo-module-dev (orm, computed-fields, performance)
- **Tags**: stackoverflow, computed-field, store, cache, performance

### 19. Odoo Forum: wkhtmltopdf in Docker Configuration

- **Link**: https://www.odoo.com/forum/help-1/wkhtml2pdf-in-docker-253393
- **Date/Version**: 2024-08
- **Source Type**: Odoo Forum
- **Quality Score**: 75 (recent + docker + wkhtmltopdf solution)
- **Takeaway**: Add system parameter report.url=http://127.0.0.1:8069/ to fix wkhtmltopdf rendering issues in Docker
- **Snippet**: Settings → Technical → Parameters → System Parameters, key=report.url, value=http://127.0.0.1:8069/
- **Application**: odoo-docker-claude (docker, wkhtmltopdf, pdf-rendering)
- **Tags**: forum, docker, wkhtmltopdf, pdf, configuration

### 20. DEV Community: Odoo Docker Print Bug Fix

- **Link**: https://dev.to/drownie/odoo-docker-fix-print-bug-3phj
- **Date/Version**: 2024
- **Source Type**: Community Blog
- **Quality Score**: 65 (recent + docker solution + practical)
- **Takeaway**: Missing headers/CSS in PDFs caused by wkhtmltopdf URL access issues; configure report.url system parameter
- **Snippet**: wkhtmltopdf cannot access internal URLs in Docker; set report.url to container's internal address
- **Application**: odoo-docker-claude (docker, wkhtmltopdf, debugging)
- **Tags**: docker, wkhtmltopdf, pdf, debugging, configuration

## Docker/Infrastructure References (4 citations)

### 21. Production Nginx Reverse Proxy Configuration

- **Link**: https://medium.com/@karan.bk/configure-odoo-with-nginx-as-a-reverse-proxy-9b758056de66
- **Date/Version**: 2024
- **Source Type**: Community Article
- **Quality Score**: 75 (recent + production deployment + nginx patterns)
- **Takeaway**: Enable proxy_mode=true in odoo.conf when running Odoo behind Nginx reverse proxy
- **Snippet**: Nginx acts as intermediary between client and Odoo; allows access without adding ":8069" to domain
- **Application**: odoo-docker-claude (deployment, nginx, reverse-proxy)
- **Tags**: nginx, reverse-proxy, production, deployment

### 22. Docker Nginx Reverse Proxy with Let's Encrypt

- **Link**: https://github.com/Ozrlz/odoo-nginx-reverse-proxy
- **Date/Version**: 2024
- **Source Type**: GitHub Repository
- **Quality Score**: 75 (recent + docker-compose + production patterns)
- **Takeaway**: Dockerized Odoo with Nginx reverse proxy and Let's Encrypt SSL; Odoo exposes ports 8069 and 8072
- **Snippet**: docker-compose.yaml with Odoo workers, nginx container, websocket support, and SSL certificates
- **Application**: odoo-docker-claude (docker-compose, ssl, nginx)
- **Tags**: docker, nginx, ssl, letsencrypt, production

### 23. Nginx Proxy Manager for Odoo

- **Link**: https://jortdevreeze.com/blog/odoo-2/setting-up-a-reverse-proxy-for-odoo-with-nginx-proxy-manager-in-docker-8
- **Date/Version**: 2024
- **Source Type**: Community Blog
- **Quality Score**: 75 (recent + simplified approach + docker)
- **Takeaway**: Nginx Proxy Manager provides GUI for reverse proxy setup; enable websocket support and block common exploits
- **Snippet**: Enable `proxy_mode = true` in odoo.conf; Odoo ports 8069 and 8072; websocket support in Nginx Proxy Manager
- **Application**: odoo-docker-claude (nginx-proxy-manager, docker, gui)
- **Tags**: nginx-proxy-manager, docker, gui, websocket, proxy

### 24. Comprehensive Docker Production Deployment Guide

- **Link**: https://victorhachard.github.io/notes/odoo-meet-docker
- **Date/Version**: 2025-01, Odoo 11.0-18.0
- **Source Type**: Community Guide
- **Quality Score**: 85 (very recent + comprehensive + multiple versions + production focus)
- **Takeaway**: Tested on Odoo 11.0-18.0 with Ubuntu 24.04.1 LTS; covers private registry, reverse proxy, logging, PostgreSQL, Seq
- **Snippet**: Complete production setup with custom image creation, container execution, SSL/TLS, logging integration
- **Application**: odoo-docker-claude (production, deployment, logging)
- **Tags**: docker, production, deployment, postgresql, logging, ubuntu
